data.name: Trash Exchange
rules: Count the number of cards in your discard pile and shuffle them into your deck. Then discard that many cards from the top of your deck.

data.name: Dusk Ball
rules: Look at the 7 cards from the bottom of your deck. Choose 1 Pokémon you find there, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Put the remaining cards back on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Larvitar

abilities.name: Submerge
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

data.flavorText: Born deep underground, it comes aboveground and becomes a pupa once it has finished eating the surrounding soil.

data.name: Palpitoad

attacks.name: Mini Earthquake
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: When they vibrate the bumps on their heads, they can make waves in water or earthquake-like vibrations on land.

data.name: Pikachu

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It occasionally uses an electric shock to recharge a fellow Pikachu that is in a weakened state.

data.name: Oranguru

abilities.name: Instruct
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw cards until you have 3 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Deep in the jungle, high in the lofty canopy, this Pokémon abides. On rare occasions, it shows up at the beach to match wits with Slowking.

data.name: Meowth

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: It is nocturnal in nature. If it spots something shiny, its eyes glitter brightly.

data.name: Vigoroth

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its stress level rises if it cannot keep moving constantly. Too much stress makes it feel sick.

data.name: Relicanth

attacks.name: Deep Sea Boring
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Trainer card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Water Pulse
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: Thought to have gone extinct, Relicanth was given a name that is a variation of the name of the person who discovered it.

data.name: Seismitoad-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Quaking Punch
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Item cards from his or her hand during his or her next turn.

attacks.name: Grenade Hammer
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 2 of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Energy Search
rules: Search your deck for a basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Mime Jr.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Mr. Mime from your hand onto Mime Jr. (this counts as evolving Mime Jr.) and remove all damage counters from Mime Jr.

attacks.name: Encore
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can use only that attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: It mimics the expressions and motions of those it sees to understand the feelings of others.

abilities.name: Shuffle
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Unown and switch it with Unown. (Any cards attached to Unown, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Unown on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Shuffle Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Hidden Power
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Supporter cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Team Galactic's Invention G-103 Power Spray
rules: You may play this card during your opponent's turn when your opponent's Pokémon uses any Poké-Power. Prevent all effects of that Poké-Power. (This counts as that Pokémon using its Poké-Power.) If you have 2 or less Pokémon SP in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Celebi

attacks.name: Time Call
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a card that evolves from 1 of your Pokémon and put it onto that Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It has the power to travel across time, but it is said to appear only in peaceful times.

attacks.name: Rock Hurl
attacks.text: Don't apply Resistance.

data.name: Pidgey

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.flavorText: A common sight in forests and woods. It flaps its wings at ground level to kick up blinding sand.

data.name: Garbodor

abilities.name: Poisonous Puddle
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if a Stadium is in play, you may make your opponent's Active Pokémon Poisoned.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon eats trash, which turns into poison inside its body. The main component of the poison depends on what sort of trash was eaten.

data.name: Fossil Excavator
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.

Search your deck or discard pile for a Trainer card that has Fossil in its name or a Stage 1 or Stage 2 Evolution card that evolves from a Fossil. Show it to your opponent and put it into your hand. If you searched your deck, shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Team Galactic's Mars
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Draw 2 cards. Then, choose a card from your opponent's hand without looking and put it on the bottom of his or her deck.

data.name: Altar of the Moone
rules: The Retreat Cost of each Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) that has any Psychic or Darkness Energy attached to it is ColorlessColorless less.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Skitty

attacks.name: Growl
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: It can't stop itself from chasing moving things, and it runs in a circle, chasing its own tail.

data.name: Fossil Excavation Map
rules:
Choose 1:
• Search your deck for an Unidentified Fossil card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
• Put an Unidentified Fossil card from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Larvitar

attacks.name: Second Strike
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has 3 or more damage counters on it, this attack does 70 more damage.

data.flavorText: Born deep underground, it comes aboveground and becomes a pupa once it has finished eating the surrounding soil.

data.name: Seismitoad

abilities.name: Bulldoze
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a card, shuffle your deck, then put that card on top of it.

attacks.name: Tremulous Fist
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each of your Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it.

data.flavorText: It increases the power of its punches by vibrating the bumps on its fists. It can turn a boulder to rubble with one punch.

data.name: Energy Retrieval
rules: Put 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Acerola
rules: Put 1 of your Pokémon that has any damage counters on it and all cards attached to it into your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Professor Sycamore
rules: Discard your hand and draw 7 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Xerosic
rules: Choose a Pokémon Tool or Special Energy card attached to a Pokémon in play (yours or your opponent's) and discard it.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Sharpedo

abilities.name: Greedy Evolution
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may look at the top 6 cards of your deck and attach any number of Darkness Energy cards you find there to this Pokémon. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

attacks.name: Bad Fangs
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Darkness Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: People believe that carrying one of its discarded fangs will prevent mishaps at sea, so the fangs are made into accessories.

data.name: Watchog

attacks.name: Fast Swipe
attacks.text: Discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Biting Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: Using luminescent matter, it makes its eyes and body glow and stuns attacking opponents.

abilities.name: Conductive Body
abilities.text: You pay Colorless less to retreat Magnemite for each Magnemite on your Bench.

attacks.name: Magnetic Bomb
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage. If tails, Magnemite does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Garbodor

abilities.name: Garbotoxin
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, each Pokémon in play, in each player's hand, and in each player's discard pile has no Abilities (except for Garbotoxin).

data.flavorText: This extremely rare Pokémon is a different color than usual. It is very hard to find.

data.name: Type: Null

attacks.name: Merciless Strike
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: The heavy control mask it wears suppresses its intrinsic capabilities. This Pokémon has some hidden special power.

data.name: Gardevoir

abilities.name: Psychic Mirage
abilities.text: Each basic Psychic Energy attached to your Psychic Pokémon provides PsychicPsychic Energy. You can't apply more than 1 Psychic Mirage Ability at a time.

attacks.name: Mind Shock
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

data.flavorText: This extremely rare Pokémon is a different color than usual. It is very hard to find.

data.name: Charon's Choice
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, put this card into your hand instead of discarding it.

Search your deck for any Rotom and switch it with any Rotom you have in play. Any cards attached to Rotom and damage counters on it are now on the new Pokémon. (Remove all Special Conditions and effects from Rotom.) Put Rotom on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Pheromosa

attacks.name: White Ray
attacks.text: If you have only 1 Prize card remaining, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.flavorText: One of the Ultra Beasts. It refuses to touch anything, perhaps because it senses some uncleanness in this world.

data.name: Big Malasada
rules: Heal 20 damage and remove a Special Condition from your Active Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Ralts

attacks.name: Hypnotic Gaze
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: If its horns capture the warm feelings of people or Pokémon, its body warms up slightly.

data.name: Energy Removal
rules: Choose 1 Energy card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and discard it.

data.name: Gible
data.flavorText: It reacts to anything that moves—flies right at it and bites it. Sometimes it injures itself, but it doesn't care too much.

data.name: Zweilous
data.flavorText: While hunting for prey, Zweilous wanders its territory, its two heads often bickering over which way to go.

data.name: Forretress

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Double KO
attacks.text: Both Active Pokémon are Knocked Out.

data.flavorText: In the moment that it gulps down its prey, the inside of its shell is exposed, but to this day, no one has ever seen that sight.

data.name: Sabrina's Psychic Control
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a Trainer card in your opponent's discard pile that isn't put in play (like PlusPower or Mysterious Fossil). You may use that card as if it were in your hand, if you do everything required in order to play that card (like discarding cards). The card stays in your opponent's discard pile.

data.name: Noivern

attacks.name: Tuning
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw a number of cards equal to the number of cards in your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Air Slash
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The ultrasonic waves it emits from its ears can reduce a large boulder to pebbles. It emerges out of the dark to attack.

data.name: Slaking

abilities.name: Lazy
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Pokémon in play have no Abilities, except for Lazy.

attacks.name: Critical Move
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon. It can't attack during your next turn.

data.flavorText: It is the world's most slothful Pokémon. However, it can exert horrifying power by releasing pent-up energy all at once.

rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
If the Pokémon this card is attached to is Knocked Out by damage from an attack, put that Pokémon into your hand. (Discard all cards attached to that Pokémon.)
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon. If tails, this Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: Adores round objects. It wanders the streets on a nightly basis to look for dropped loose change.

data.name: Pidgeot

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spin Storm
attacks.text: Your opponent puts their Active Pokémon and all cards attached to it into their hand.

data.flavorText: When hunting, it skims the surface of water at high speed to pick off unwary prey such as Magikarp.

data.name: Spoink

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Bounce
attacks.text: You may switch Spoink with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It bounces constantly, using its tail like a spring. The shock of bouncing keeps its heart beating.

data.name: Aqua Patch
rules: Attach a Water Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Water Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Exp. Share
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
When your Active Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, you may move 1 basic Energy card that was attached to that Pokémon to the Pokémon this card is attached to.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Nincada

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Dash Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It grows underground, sensing its surroundings using antennae instead of its virtually blind eyes.

data.name: Carbink

attacks.name: Diamond Gate
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Supporter card and a Stadium card, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: Although this Pokémon is not especially rare, its glittering, jewel-draped body draws attention from people.

data.name: Garchomp

abilities.name: Avenging Aura
abilities.text: If you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent, this Pokémon's attacks do 80 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Over Slice
attacks.text: You may discard an Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.flavorText: It flies at the speed of sound while searching for prey, and it has midair battles with Salamence as the two compete for food.

data.name: Bouffalant

attacks.name: Tool Breaker
attacks.text: Discard a Pokémon Tool card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: They are known to charge so wildly that if a train were to enter their territory, they would send it flying.

data.name: Energy Retrieval
rules: Put 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Night Maintenance
rules: Search your discard pile for up to 3 in any combination of Pokémon and basic Energy cards. Show them to your opponent and shuffle them into your deck.

data.name: Pancham
data.flavorText: It follows Pangoro around like a henchman. When Pancham makes a big mistake, its leaf gets taken away.

data.name: Mystery Energy
rules: This card can only be attached to Psychic Pokémon. This card provides Psychic Energy only while this card is attached to a Psychic Pokémon.
The Retreat Cost of the Pokémon this card is attached to is ColorlessColorless less.
(If this card is attached to anything other than a Psychic Pokémon, discard this card.)

data.name: Whismur

attacks.name: Wail
attacks.text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: If it senses danger, it scares the foe by crying out with the volume of a jet-plane engine.

data.name: Switch
rules: Switch 1 of your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Manaphy

attacks.name: Marine Guidance
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Water Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Aqua Ring
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It starts its life with a wondrous power that permits it to bond with any kind of Pokémon.

data.name: Escape Rope
rules: Each player switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon. Your opponent switches first. (If a player does not have a Benched Pokémon, that player doesn't switch Pokémon.)
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Pokémon Catcher
rules: Switch your opponent's Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Sandile

abilities.name: Intimidating Fang
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks do 20 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: Alola, where it's warm all year round, is a comfortable environment for this Pokémon. Sometimes you'll even see it outside of deserts.

data.name: Gardevoir-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Life Leap
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Shining Wind
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon has no Weakness.

data.name: Viridian City Gym
rules: This card stays in play after being played. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.
Whenever a Pokémon with Giovanni in its name evolves, its owner removes 2 damage counters from that Pokémon (or 1 if it only has 1).

attacks.name: Charge
attacks.text: Attach 1 Lightning Energy card from your discard pile to Mareep.

data.name: Team Rocket's Handiwork
rules: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, discard 2 cards from the top of your opponent's deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Mandibuzz

attacks.name: Bone Rush
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Blindside
attacks.text: This attack does 100 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Although it's a bit of a ruffian, this Pokémon will take lost Vullaby under its wing and care for them till they're ready to leave the nest.

attacks.name: Sleep Powder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Armor Fossil
rules: Play Armor Fossil as if it were a Colorless Basic Pokémon. (Armor Fossil counts as a Trainer card as well, but if Armor Fossil is Knocked Out, this counts as a Knocked Out Pokémon.) Armor Fossil can't be affected by any Special Conditions and can't retreat. At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Armor Fossil from play. (This doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Armor Stone
abilities.text: Whenever Armor Fossil would be damaged by your opponent's attack, flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, reduce that damage by 10.

abilities.name: Shuffle
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Unown and switch it with Unown. (Any cards attached to Unown, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Unown on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Shuffle Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Hidden Power
attacks.text: Search your opponent's discard pile for a Supporter card and use the effect of that card as the effect of this attack. (The Supporter card remains in your opponent's discard pile.)

data.name: Gardevoir

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Eternal Radiance
attacks.text: Move all damage counters from this Pokémon to the Defending Pokémon. This Pokémon can't use Eternal Radiance during your next turn.

data.flavorText: To protect its Trainer, it will expend all its psychic power to create a small black hole.

data.name: Pidove

attacks.name: Razor Wind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: This very forgetful Pokémon will wait for a new order from its Trainer even though it already has one.

data.name: Switch
rules: Switch 1 of your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Drampa

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dragon Pulse
attacks.text: Discard the top 2 cards of your deck.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon is friendly to people and loves children most of all. It comes from deep in the mountains to play with children it likes in town.

data.name: Blend Energy GrassFirePsychicDarkness
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy. When this card is attached to a Pokémon, this card provides Grass, Fire, Psychic, or Darkness Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time.

data.name: Hoopa

attacks.name: Assault Gate
attacks.text: If this Pokémon didn't move from the Bench to the Active Spot this turn, this attack does nothing. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness.

data.flavorText: It gathers things it likes and passes them through its loop to teleport them to a secret place.

data.name: Beldum

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: If you anger it, it will do more than rampage. It will also burst out strong magnetism, causing nearby machines to break.

data.name: Battle Reporter
rules: Draw cards until you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Puzzle of Time
rules:
You may play 2 Puzzle of Time cards at once.
• If you played 1 card, look at the top 3 cards of your deck and put them back in any order.
• If you played 2 cards, put 2 cards from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Max Potion
rules: Heal all damage from 1 of your Pokémon. Then, discard all Energy attached to that Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Kartana-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Slice Off
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may discard a Special Energy from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Gale Blade
attacks.text: You may shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck.

attacks.name: Blade-GX
attacks.text: Take a Prize card. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Darkrai

attacks.name: Abyssal Sleep
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep. Your opponent flips 2 coins instead of 1 between turns. If either of them is tails, that Pokémon is still Asleep.

data.flavorText: It can lull people to sleep and make them dream. It is active during nights of the new moon.

data.name: Energy Switch
rules: Move a basic Energy from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

attacks.name: Grandiose Fangs
attacks.text: If your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from this attack, this Pokémon's attacks do 120 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon during your next turn (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: Alola, where it's warm all year round, is a comfortable environment for this Pokémon. Sometimes you'll even see it outside of deserts.

rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 60 more damage.

attacks.name: Simultaneous Peck
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If either of them is tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Doduo Delivery
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

data.flavorText: The brains in its two heads appear to communicate emotions to each other with a telepathic power.

attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: The shock waves from its cries can tip over trucks. It stamps its feet to power up.

data.name: M Gardevoir-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Brilliant Voice
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Round
attacks.text: Does 30 damage times the number of your Pokémon that have the Round attack.

data.name: Ultra Ball
rules: Discard 2 cards from your hand. (If you can't discard 2 cards, you can't play this card.) Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Ultra Ball
rules: Discard 2 cards from your hand. (If you can't discard 2 cards, you can't play this card.) Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Guzma
rules: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon. If you do, switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Fervor
rules: Show the top 3 cards of your deck to all players. Put any Fire Energy cards there into your hand and discard the rest.

data.name: Alolan Meowth

attacks.name: Spoil the Fun
attacks.text: If you go second, this attack does 60 more damage during your first turn.

data.flavorText: When its delicate pride is wounded, or when the gold coin on its forehead is dirtied, it flies into a hysterical rage.

data.name: Rufflet

attacks.name: Incessant Peck
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: It stands up to massive opponents, not out of courage, but out of recklessness. But that is how it gets stronger.

abilities.name: Shuffle
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Unown and switch it with Unown. (Any cards attached to Unown, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Unown on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Shuffle Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Hidden Power
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of either player's Evolved Pokémon, remove the highest Stage Evolution card from that Pokémon, and put it into that player's hand.

data.name: Quick Ball
rules: Reveal cards from your deck until you reveal a Pokémon. Show that Pokémon to your opponent and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other revealed cards back into your deck. (If you don't reveal a Pokémon, shuffle all the revealed cards back into your deck.)

data.name: Nickit

attacks.name: Tail Whip
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't attack.

data.flavorText: Aided by the soft pads on its feet, it silently raids the food stores of other Pokémon. It survives off its ill-gotten gains.

data.name: Blend Energy WaterLightningFightingMetal
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy. When this card is attached to a Pokémon, this card provides Water, Lightning, Fighting, or Metal Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time.

data.name: Poké Ball
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, you may search your deck for any Basic Pokémon or Evolution card. Show that card to your opponent, then put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Pangoro
data.flavorText: This rowdy Pokémon boasts great physical strength. Many Trainers are also smitten by its lively character.

data.name: Reverse Valley
rules: Choose which way this card faces before you play it. Any damage done to this ↓ player's Metal Pokémon by an opponent's attack is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Choose which way this card faces before you play it. The attacks of this ↓ player's Darkness Pokémon do 10 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Riolu
data.flavorText: It knows how people and Pokémon feel by looking at their auras. It doesn't approach dangerous opponents.

data.name: Skull Fossil
rules: Play Skull Fossil as if it were a Colorless Basic Pokémon. (Skull Fossil counts as a Trainer card as well, but if Skull Fossil is Knocked Out, this counts as a Knocked Out Pokémon.) Skull Fossil can't be affected by any Special Conditions and can't retreat. At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Skull Fossil from play. (This doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Skull Stone
abilities.text: During your opponent's turn, if Skull Fossil would be Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, put 1 damage counter on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Poison Claws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Empoleon LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Empoleon. Empoleon LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Supreme Command
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may choose up to 2 cards from your opponent's hand without looking and put them face down next to the Defending Pokémon. (These cards are not in play or in your opponent's hand.) At the end of your opponent's next turn, return those cards to your opponent's hand. This power can't be used if Empoleon is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Hydro Impact
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 80 damage to that Pokémon (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Empoleon can't attack during your next turn.

data.name: Alolan Exeggutor-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Tower-Go-Round-GX
attacks.text: Move any number of Energy from your Pokémon to your other Pokémon in any way you like. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Ancient Crystal
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
The Regirock, Regice, Registeel, or Regigigas this card is attached to takes 30 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Max Revive
rules: Put a Pokémon from your discard pile on top of your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Meowth
data.flavorText: When visiting a junkyard, you may catch sight of it having an intense fight with Murkrow over shiny objects.

data.name: Darkness Energy
rules: If the Pokémon Darkness Energy is attached to attacks, the attack does 10 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). Ignore this effect if the Pokémon that Darkness Energy is attached to isn't Darkness. Darkness Energy provides Darkness Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

data.name: Metang
data.flavorText: It flies at high speeds around the skies. When it finds its prey, Metang takes a firm grip with its sharp claws and never lets go.

data.name: Lycanroc

attacks.name: Dangerous Rogue
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Bathed in the setting sun of evening, Lycanroc has undergone a special kind of evolution. An intense fighting spirit underlies its calmness.

data.name: Galarian Obstagoon

abilities.name: Untamed Shout
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may put 3 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Obstruct
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Basic Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It evolved after experiencing numerous fights. While crossing its arms, it lets out a shout that would make any opponent flinch.

attacks.name: Pachi
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

data.flavorText: A pair may be seen rubbing their cheek pouches together in an effort to share stored electricity.

data.flavorText: Its body is virtually composed of water. It shoots strange beams from its crystal-like eyes.

rules: Heal 20 damage from each of your Pokémon.

data.name: Lady

data.flavorText: Its hard pincers are well suited to both offense and defense. Fights between two Crabrawler are like boxing matches.

You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.flavorText: It analyzes its opponents with more accuracy than a supercomputer, which enables it to calmly back them into a corner.

data.flavorText: It looks down on everyone other than itself. Its preferred tactics are sucker punches and blindside attacks.

abilities.text: If Mr. Mime would be damaged by an attack, reduce that damage by 10 for each basic Energy card attached to Mr. Mime. The maximum amount of damage that can be reduced by Energy Barrier is 20.

attacks.name: Mind Shock
attacks.text: Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

rules: Double Colorless Energy provides ColorlessColorless Energy.

data.name: Metal Energy
rules: Damage done by attacks to the Pokémon that Metal Energy is attached to is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). Ignore this effect if the Pokémon that Metal Energy is attached to isn't Metal. Metal Energy provides Metal Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

data.name: Riolu
data.flavorText: It knows how people and Pokémon feel by looking at their auras. It doesn't approach dangerous opponents.

data.name: Guzma
rules: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon. If you do, switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Scizor Spirit Link
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes M Scizor-EX.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

abilities.name: Shuffle
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Unown and switch it with Unown. (Any cards attached to Unown, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Unown on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Shuffle Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Hidden Power
attacks.text: If your opponent's Bench isn't full, look at his or her hand. Choose 1 Basic Pokémon you find there and put it onto your opponent's Bench. Then, switch it with the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch.

data.name: Potion
rules: Remove up to 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon.

data.name: Exploud

attacks.name: Dangerous Concert
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Its roar in battle shakes the ground like a tremor—or like an earthquake has struck.

data.name: Infernape LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Infernape. Infernape LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Burning Head
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at the top 3 cards of your deck, choose 1 of them, and put it into your hand. Discard the other 2 cards. This power can't be used if Infernape is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Flare Up
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for 8 Fire Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and shuffle them into your deck. (This attack does nothing if you don't have 8 Fire Energy cards in your discard pile.)

data.name: Team Galactic's Wager
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.

Each player shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck, and you and your opponent play "Rock-Paper-Scissors." The player who wins draws up to 6 cards. The player who loses draws up to 3 cards. (You draw your cards first.)

data.name: Thievul

attacks.name: Nasty Plot
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: It secretly marks potential targets with a scent. By following the scent, it stalks its targets and steals from them when they least expect it.

data.name: Krokorok

attacks.name: Corner
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: Krokorok really hates it when its body gets cold. On nights when the temperature drops, it digs deep into the desert sands.

attacks.name: Max Voltage

data.flavorText: When its opponent can't be paralyzed, it contorts itself with unexpected speed and flops away.

data.name: Rockruff
data.flavorText: As they develop, their disposition grows more violent and aggressive. Many Trainers find them too much to handle and abandon them.

rules: This card can only be attached to Fighting Pokémon. This card provides Fighting Energy only while this card is attached to a Fighting Pokémon.
